title: Curriculum Development Practical Competency Enhancement: Computer-Based Patient Education Program Design – Case Study on Kidney Diseases

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Learners collect three chronic kidney disease patient education scenarios, perform data preprocessing and model building using statistical templates (e.g., logistic regression, survival analysis), and write an analysis report achieving ≥70% model accuracy.

Learners prototype one educational content design implementable on low-spec devices (≤2GB RAM) and offline environments using HTML5/CSS3/JS, and submit evaluation reports meeting functionality (≥4.0/5.0) and accessibility (≥3.5/5.0) standards in user testing (≥5 participants).

Learners analyze diagnostic data for specific patient groups (e.g., diabetes patients) using medical data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI), develop ≥3 customized educational materials (infographics, videos, interactive charts), and achieve ≥80% in peer reviews and instructor rubrics (clarity, accuracy, creativity).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
